titleStmt.title: J. K. Sumrall to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6707

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Maysville Kentucky
Oct 14" 1865
His Excellency Thomas E Bramlet. Governer of Kentucky
Dr Sir

I would not address you this -- letter -- but fearing that the press of public business & calls of public duty, have caused you to overlook a petition, signed by a great many of the most respectable citizens of Maysville in behalf of a poor-ignorant Irish man -- I therefore address to call your attention to the matter -- if hapily it has escaped your attention It is the petition of Patrick Nyland of this place or rather in his behalf. the petition of
of many citizens of Maysville well & personally known to yourself -- The petition was forwarded to you at Frankfort, some time in the early part of August last -- but no response has been received by Clerk of Mason Circuit Court -- Your early attention to the matter, will much oblige the many petitioners whose names are therto signed, as well as your very humble fellow citizen &c

J. K. Sumrall
Atty at Law
Maysville Ky
